descr.p: Timothy B. Schmit (1982), Art Garfunkel (1988), All-4-One (1993)

"So Much in Love" is a popular song sung by The Tymes that was a number-one song in the United States during the year 1963. It was The Tymes first hit single. It topped the Billboard Hot 100 singles chart on August 3, 1963, and remained there for one week. The song was written by George William, Bill Jackson and arranged by Roy Strighis.

The song has been covered several times since the original version was recorded. "So Much in Love" was sung by former Eagle Timothy B. Schmit on the soundtrack to Fast Times at Ridgemont Highreleased in 1982 and reached #59 on the Hot 100 as a single. A 1988 rendition by Art Garfunkel got to #11 on the Adult Contemporary chart, but the most successful remake of the song was by the R&B vocal group All-4-One, who released "So Much in Love" in late 1993 as their debut single. The All-4-One version peaked at #5 on the Hot 100 in early 1994 and was certified Gold.Another group AFD (All Females Desired) did a remake of the song.
